Reviews.Title: “Capital Inn, Rome (Giardinetti)”
Reviews.Author: eciarma
Reviews.Content: Hello fellow travelers, If you're looking for a clean, inexpensive hotel away from the hustle and bustle of Rome, this is a great place to stay. Only minutes away from the train station, this property is well located in a quiet and safe suburb called Giardinetti. Although internet connectivity is not included (and is a bit pricey) and the shower stalls were quite small, overall, the rooms were spacious, clean and quiet. The full breakfast menu in the morning also included a full variety of delicious fruit, meats, pastries, juices, and fresh Espresso coffee. Service was always top-notch, courteous and very polite. Would I stay there again the next time I visit Rome? Absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “Almost 4 stars hotel but outside Rome!”
Reviews.Author: maniac_the_evil
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great, situated outside Rome. The rooms are clean and enormous.Huge space inside. Nice terace and a big restaurant. At the reception they didn't had a city map, and when I was going to the bar for buying a beer, in the menu it was 3 euro. So the first and second night the same beer costed 4 euro and in the third it was 5 euro, no receipt no ticket for what i was buying, so be careful the prices are made depending their moood.

Reviews.Title: “disaster”
Reviews.Author: marietta025
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 days staying at this hotel and my experience was horrible.That place is located miles away from the city center and we wasted one hour at least every morning in order to get in our destination downtown.Nothing in our room foctioned properly.we are obliged to wait for centuries in order to get electricity after we put our card on.the bathroom was tiny with only two bodytowels for three people.they made us to stay 3 students in a room for two and the third bed was nothing more than a camp bed.we have breakfast and dinner at the hotel!food and service were unspeakable...dinner was tastless.we ate every day the same first plate and two days we had fruits for desert!!!!None of waiters spoke english or french!!!To sum up I would never suggest to anyone this place!!!!!!there are far better hotels in the eternal city,Rome P.S excuse my english

Reviews.Title: “Disgrace”
Reviews.Author: Sammut79
Reviews.Content: This was my worst ever experience in a Hotel. The location is very dirty and seems to be a scrap-yard. It is found outside of the ringroad, and along one of the most traffic jamed streets leading to the centre. If you are lucky you'll get to termini, in an hour. The hotel, is a 4 star? Hard to believe it. Mostly when you see all the cockroaches, and the arrogance of its Manager. If you want to try you luck with this hotel, just go ahead. But be careful, there are a lot of better Hotels in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “In the BoonDocks”
Reviews.Author: Atenant
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on 10/03 to 10/5 with a group tour. The hotel is rated as four stars, but not up to the standards of the US or Canadian hotels. I would say it is not better than three star. The rooms are large with hardwood floors that are noisy and dimmly lighted with a single 22w round fluorescent bulb overhead. The shower is a challenge because it is small and the shower head sprays into all corners of the stall. If you wanted to turn the water on and adjust the temperature before you get in, you'll end up with a very wet floor in front of the shower. You also can't do much to dry up the wet floor because you only get two bath towels and four thin hand towels that resemble table napkins. No bathmats. The room door needs to be slammed shut. One day I came back from a day in town and found the door left open, probably courtesy of the cleaning staff. If you want to visit Rome, don't stay here, it will take you at least 1 to 2 hours to get to the city. Terrible waste of valuable vacation time when you're stuck in traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is miles away from the city center, more than 80 minutes, depending on the traffic (that's not thier fault) the food very much below standard and the staff very rude in general ( that is thier fault). We were travelling with a group, it is obvious that the agency were looking to save money.

Reviews.Title: “Want Rude Treatment in an Inconvenient Location? Then This is Your Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I escaped from this place yesterday. Specific examples: 1. TV clicker (scotch-taped to keep it closed); brought it to the desk and after saying politely it didn't work the clerk got very agitated speaking in loud Italian, proceeded to dump a box of remotes onto the counter! Finally took another, also scotch-taped shut- it worked only if you pressed really hard on the battery case, although none of the channels were in English anyway (no CNN Europe,etc) 2. Door key didn't work 3 different times in 4 days- had to bring it down to the desk each time to have them do something with the computer to fix it- never a small apology for the inconvenience, acted put out. 3. Food was very mediocre at best and I am not fussy (I go to McDonalds often). 3 levels below Olive Garden. A co-traveler remarked that he had always heard about Italian food- all in our group were disappointed at the quality here. 4. The restaurant manager one evening loudly berating one of the wait staff for over 5 minutes- not too pleasant to dine by. 5. In bad neighborhood, miles and miles from anything remotely of interest as a tourist and 65 Euro taxi ride from the main airport. 6. I was with a tour group- apparently chosen on the cheap by the tour operator to cut costs. Everyone on the tour was actually laughing at how surly the staff were- everyone couldn't wait to get out of there. 7. The rooms are big but the beds small, no carpeting. 8. Brush up on your Italian/ sign language as the desk staff can't speak English (to be fair, perhaps equal to my high school French in fluency) 9. No Rome cab drivers have ever heard of it because it is so far off the beaten path- bring a map and directions in Italian if you are forced to stay here. 10. This supposedly 4 star hotel couldn't compete with a Days Inn/Comfort Inn/Red Roof Inn/ Motel 6 in the US- don't go here unless you want to share funny stories years later of appallingly rude service that was so bad it was funny.

Reviews.Title: “out of the way”
Reviews.Author: dzohar
Reviews.Content: The Capital Inn Hotel is located east of the Ring Road that encircles Rome. To get into the city one can catch a light railway (5 minutes walk away at Giardinetta station) that goes to Termini downtown, about 40 minutes ride, stops frequently.. Otherwise access is by car or tourist bus. Breakfast was modest. The TV worked only in Italian. The aircondition was out of order.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Capital Inn
HotelInfo.Address: Via C.Santarelli 96, 00133 Rome, Italy
